name: Tomoki Kameda
bio:
Tomoki Kameda, also known as "Kameda-ke Saishū Heiki" and "El Mexicanito," is a Japanese professional boxer who has made a name for himself in the bantamweight and super bantamweight divisions. Born on July 12, 1991, Kameda has been a force to be reckoned with in the ring, utilizing his skills and determination to achieve success.

Standing at a height of 171cm with a reach of 170cm, Kameda possesses the physical attributes that make him a formidable opponent. His orthodox stance, combined with his speed and agility, allows him to deliver precise and powerful punches to his opponents.

Weighing in at 55.34kg, Kameda competes in the bantamweight and super bantamweight weight classes. These divisions require careful attention to weight management and conditioning in order to excel. Kameda's dedication to his craft and commitment to maintaining his weight demonstrate his professionalism and determination to succeed.

Kameda's journey in the boxing world has been an impressive one. He first burst onto the scene in 2008 when he made his professional debut at just 17 years old. Since then, he has faced numerous opponents and has proven time and time again that he has what it takes to come out on top.

One of the highlights of Kameda's career came in December 2011 when he captured the WBC Youth Intercontinental Bantamweight title by defeating Silvester Lopez. This victory showcased Kameda's skills and marked a significant milestone in his career.

However, Kameda's success doesn't end there. In May 2013, he won the WBC Bantamweight title by defeating Paulus Ambunda. This win solidified Kameda's position as a top fighter in his weight class and further cemented his reputation as a force in the ring.

But Kameda's journey has not been without its challenges. In August 2015, he suffered his first professional loss to Jamie McDonnell in a bout for the WBA World Bantamweight title. Despite the setback, Kameda remained resilient and determined to come back stronger than ever.

Throughout his career, Kameda has displayed a unique style that sets him apart from other fighters. His ability to switch between orthodox and southpaw stances keeps his opponents guessing and makes him a difficult target to hit. This versatility showcases his adaptability and strategic approach to the sport.

Another noteworthy aspect of Kameda's career is his international experience. He has fought in countries such as Mexico, the United States, and Japan, facing opponents from different backgrounds and fighting styles. This exposure to varied competition has undoubtedly contributed to Kameda's growth as a boxer.

Outside of the ring, Kameda is known for his dedication to his training and fitness. He follows a strict regimen that includes cardio exercises, strength training, and sparring sessions to stay in top shape. His hard work and commitment to his craft are evident in his performances inside the squared circle.

Furthermore, Kameda's passion for boxing extends beyond his own career. He comes from a family of boxers, with his brothers, Koki and Daiki, also competing in the sport. This family connection adds an extra layer of depth to Kameda's story and highlights the impact that boxing has had on his life.

In conclusion, Tomoki Kameda is a formidable boxer who has achieved success in the bantamweight and super bantamweight divisions. His dedication, skill, and versatility make him a force to be reckoned with in the ring. Despite facing setbacks, Kameda's resilience and determination have propelled him to capture titles and gain international recognition. As he continues his journey in the boxing world, it will be exciting to see how Kameda's career unfolds and what accomplishments he will achieve next.
